call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - October 10th 2024

topics.title: Sigma 6.0 Release and Sub-blocks Development
topics.summary: kushti announces two reference client releases (5.0.23 and 6.0.0.2) with Sigma 6.0 functionality. He explains progress on sub-blocks implementation, which aims to make block parameters configurable without hard forks, and discusses the need for security proofs before activation.

topics.title: MEV and Network Structure Philosophy
topics.summary: Armeanio discusses the benefits of public MEV in proof-of-work systems versus private mempools in structured networks. He argues that distributing MEV to miners creates better incentive alignment and supports retail users compared to centralized validator systems.

topics.title: Silver Stablecoin and Hard Asset Tokenization
topics.summary: Armeanio outlines plans to fork the Oracle framework to create a silver-backed stablecoin. He discusses the potential for digital representations of precious metals as peer-to-peer currencies, drawing parallels to the historical eGold system but with decentralized infrastructure.

topics.title: Rosen Bridge Public Testing and Launch Timeline
topics.summary: Armeanio provides updates on Rosen bridge testing with 38 watchers using artificial test tokens. He explains the upcoming bulk minting phase to scale supported assets and outlines the path to mainnet launch including UI updates and final checks.

topics.title: Ledger Integration Progress and Hardware Wallet Support
topics.summary: kushti reports on new Ledger integration requirements for Stax and Flex devices, with a developer already working on support. He also announces a 3000 ERG bounty for Keystone integration and mentions potential improvements to token limits per output.

topics.title: Dexy Audit Completion and Mainnet Preparation
topics.summary: kushti reports that Dexy's audit is complete with code fixes implemented. The team is updating the whitepaper and preparing for mainnet launch with improved deployment procedures based on lessons learned from SigmaUSD deployment.

topics.title: Soft Fork Capabilities and Protocol Governance
topics.summary: kushti explains Ergo's advanced soft fork capabilities, including 90% supermajority voting for parameter changes and the ability to add new data structures without hard forks. He plans to propose making sub-blocks per block configurable through this mechanism.

topics.title: Marketing Structure and Decentralized Protocol Philosophy
topics.summary: kushti and Armeanio discuss the nature of marketing for decentralized protocols, comparing Ergo to Bitcoin's organic growth model. They critique centralized networks as resembling traditional databases like PayPal rather than true peer-to-peer systems.

topics.title: Cardano Funding and Stablecoin Market Strategy
topics.summary: Armeanio explains the rationale for requesting additional Cardano funding to support projects accessing stablecoin-rich environments. He discusses high exchange listing costs, market making requirements, and how Rosen provides lower-cost alternatives to traditional exchange listings.

topics.title: Dan Palmyra Promotion and Marketing Concerns
topics.summary: Community questions about Dan's Palmyra promotion to Cardano without mentioning Ergo. Armeanio defends Dan's right to focus on his own project while kushti mentions upcoming Dubai meetings and plans to monitor Dan's Ergo mentions in presentations.

topics.title: Community Sentiment and Development Focus
topics.summary: Addressing community negativity concerns, Armeanio emphasizes focusing on building the future rather than market conditions. He advocates for maintaining practical development approaches aligned with Ergo's manifesto and principles despite emotional community reactions.

topics.title: Sigma Chain Partners and Merge Mining
topics.summary: Armeanio discusses potential Sigma chain partnerships, proposing support for miners with smaller 4GB cards who were pushed off Ergo's network. He suggests merge mining capabilities and shared computational environments as key benefits of compatible virtual machines.

topics.title: Uniswap Trading and Ethereum Market Access
topics.summary: Discussing whether Uniswap will become the biggest exchange for Ergo, Armeanio explains how Ethereum's larger user base and capital liquidity make it a superior market compared to siloed exchanges with limited active users and capital thresholds.

topics.title: Rosen Guard Security and Incentive Mechanisms
topics.summary: Addressing concerns about guards potentially refusing asset transfers, Armeanio explains the game theory behind Rosen's design. Guards face consequences for malicious behavior including removal from the network, creating proper incentive alignment.

topics.title: Rosen Light Transition and Asset Scaling
topics.summary: Armeanio explains the transition away from Rosen Light as they scale asset support beyond the initial base assets from Ergo and Hosky from Cardano. The system is moving toward supporting more projects listing in larger stablecoin-rich environments like Ethereum.

topics.title: Exchange Listing Issues and MEXC Concerns
topics.summary: Responding to MEXC listing donation refund requests, Armeanio discusses problems with centralized exchange incentive alignment. He explains how exchanges often dump native tokens after payment and predicts a shift toward on-chain stablecoin operations.

topics.title: Partner Chains and MewFinance Integration
topics.summary: Armeanio discusses confusion around partner chain terminology and highlights MewFinance's progress after merging ErgoCube and Ergo Explorer. The call concludes with mentions of Ergo Santa collaboration and Ergo Pulse podcast potential return.
